{{spoiler}} '''Heroes''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|ヒーロー}}, ''Hīrō'') are guest characters in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Heroes are special allies who can be recruited to fight alongside [[Noah]] and the other five as a seventh party member after completing the corresponding [[Hero Quest]].https://mobile.twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1542040169037312000https://twitter.com/NintendoEurope/status/1526114105869979648 While only one Hero can be in the active party, once recruited, they can be swapped in at any time.https://topics.nintendo.co.jp/article/95795fc0-a0ce-470c-bb98-9456adba1a99 However they are not controllable.https://topics.nintendo.co.jp/article/f86dd1d6-9eff-45ca-b244-fdb1174b4c84 The six playable characters can still switch their [[Class (XC3)|class]] into Hero classes after growing closer to the corresponding Heroeshttps://mobile.twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1542040672848424960, though. The exceptions are [[Shulk]] and [[Rex]], whose classes cannot be learned under any circumstances. Each Hero can also take part in [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Attacks]], with each one having a unique Heroic Chain bonus instead of the usual bonuses based on the class archetype. == List of Classes == {| class="xc1 centered sortable" ! {{spoiler}} '''Hero Quests''' are [[Quest (XC3)|quests]] in {{XC3}} involving [[Hero]]es. They are similar to [[Blade Quest]]s in {{XC2}}. Completing a Hero Quest unlocks a Hero to be usable in the party, and unlocks their [[Class (XC3)|class]] for [[Ouroboros]]. '''Ascension Quests''' are Hero Quests that, upon completion, will increase the maximum rank for corresponding Hero's class from 10 to 20. Additionally, six Side Story Quests will similarly increase the maximum rank for the base class corresponding to the party member it features. In order to be started, Ascension Quests require at least one party member to be at rank 10 with the hero's class, for the relevant hero to be in the party, and for the hero's questline to be sufficiently progressed. == List of Hero Quests == === Hero Quests === {| class="xc1 questlist chronological" ! {{for|other uses|Hit Points}} {{spoiler}} '''Hit Points''', commonly referred to as '''HP''', are a mechanic in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.
== Overview == HP is the measure of how much damage a playable character can take before becoming incapacitated. When a party member is hit by an attack that deals damage or is standing in harmful terrain, they will lose HP. HP can be restored by a [[Healer]], using specific [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Battle Arts]], or by other means.
Unlike previous games in the series, only party members in Healer roles (or anyone wearing the [[Memory Locket (XC3)|Memory Locket]] accessory) can revive other incapacitated party members; the battle is not lost if the leader is incapacitated without any means of revival, since players can assume control of other party members during battle. Battles are only lost and the party respawned at the last [[Landmark]] they visited if the whole party is incapacitated, or if the party leader falls off the map (detailed below).
A party member's HP will instantly hit 0 should they fall off the map. If this happens to characters other than the leader during battle, their incapacitated body will respawn on solid ground, and can be revived as usual. Otherwise, the party will respawn at the previous Landmark.
[[Ouroboros]] forms do not have a conventional HP stat, but taking damage instead fills up their [[Heat Gauge]]. If a pair of characters falls off the map while in an Ouroboros form, they will immediately reach Overheated status and both characters will be incapacitated as above.
The [[Class (XC3)|class system]] used in this game has a major effect on a character's HP, with characters classed into [[Defender (XC3)|Defender]] roles having substantially more HP than characters in [[Attacker]] or Healer roles; it is possible for characters to exceed 9999 HP, unlike previous games. Even so, there is a minor variation between characters' base HP values which classes modify. [[Eunie]] has the least base HP, followed by [[Taion]], [[Mio]], [[Noah]], [[Sena]], and finally [[Lanz]] has the highest base HP.
== Dying == In {{XC3|-}}, a red exclamation mark appear above team members' head whose HP are very low. This indicates that they are close to death and they need to be quickly healed.<ref>https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1550376471310454785</ref> {{clr}}
